title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 April 2012 - XWiki
content:

00:32 <rrodriguez> has quit  
00:54 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki

10:37 <jomo> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:16 <mflorea> has quit  
11:32 <jomo> hi, unfortunately I got another extension install error - can anybody point me to the right direction for solving it? http://pastebin.com/SdFBTtBp  
11:33 <vmassol> hi jomo  
11:33 <vmassol> are you using extension.xwiki.org as your remote repo?  
11:33 <jomo> HI vmassol ! ;)  
11:34 <vmassol> I'd suggest that you try out 4.0-rc-1 it probably has better error reporting and it fixed a lot stuff. It would be easier to support you  
11:34 <jomo> have all standard - have what is xwiki installed as default  
11:35 <jomo> huh - gave me severalk hours install my current version.. ;( ok - will try - must fing some upgrade guide...  
11:36 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Upgrade  
11:36 <jomo> thanx ;)  
12:26 <jomo> giving up.. ;( it is impossible for me - simple havent enough knowledge… ;( :(  
12:42 <vmassol> jomo: wait till thomas tmortagne is online maybe tomorrow or next wednesday, or better report the issue on the mailing list  
12:43 <vmassol> as I said, in 3.5 the extension manager is still very new and experimental  
12:43 <vmassol> as for upgrade it cannot be simpler  
12:43 <vmassol> you just replace you war and you're good  
12:44 <vmassol> got to go  
13:01 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:04 <Shaddox> has joined #xwiki  
13:10 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:10 <abusenius> has quit  
13:19 <mflorea> has quit  
13:35 <jomo> vmassol: sry, was afk… Upgrade failed, after replace war get zilion errors about database, postgres and so on. :( I'm an middle-level unix/sysadmin and/but don't want learn java,tomcat etc. I'm only want somewhat install xwiki and use it with some basic extensions, like able sort attachments by name.. 100 lines error messages are impossible for me to understand… maybe later will give another try - thank you for your will helping me. ;)  
13:36 <vmassol> jomo: there's no java to learn  
13:36 <vmassol> what happened is that you simply overwrote the xwiki configuration files IMO  
13:36 <jomo> maybe - i'm only simple not understand messages like: javax.servlet.ServletException: com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 3 in 0: Could not initialize main XWiki context  
13:37 <vmassol> jomo: well  
13:37 <vmassol> the problem is that you're trying to do something you shouldn't  
13:37 <vmassol> shouldn't do  
13:37 <jomo> ;)  
13:38 <vmassol> if you're not a java admin you should definitely not have to install xwiki  
13:38 <vmassol> since xwiki runs as a standard servlet applicartion  
13:38 <vmassol> what you should do instead is use an installed xwiki  
13:38 <vmassol> so several solutions:  
13:38 <vmassol> 1) have someone install it for you and use it  
13:38 <vmassol> 2) use XWiki Cloud service for ex  
13:38 <jomo> yes - understand.. ;)  
13:39 <vmassol> now  
13:39 <vmassol> of course we're trying to make it as simple as possible to use it  
13:39 <vmassol> we're working on a fully automated upgrader but it's not ready yet  
13:39 <jomo> ok - i;m don;t balme xwiki or the comuunity.. ;)  
13:40 <vmassol> btw  
13:40 <vmassol> what you can do is to download the standalone package  
13:40 <vmassol> it's one zip  
13:40 <vmassol> with everything  
13:40 <jomo> but my server is freebsd  
13:40 <vmassol> it's not tuned for production but it doesn't require any knowledge of anything  
13:40 <vmassol> so you can quickly play with xwiki  
13:41 <vmassol> that's why we made it  
13:41 <vmassol> just download it from xwiki.org (the 4.0rc1 version)  
13:41 <vmassol> you unzip and it's installed  
13:41 <polx> has quit  
13:41 <vmassol> that's all you have to do  
13:41 <jomo> have freebsd package too? probably not..  
13:41 <vmassol> wdym?  
13:41 <vmassol> it works for \*all\* OSes  
13:42 <jomo> wdym?  
13:42 <vmassol> what part?  
13:42 <vmassol> see http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download  
13:43 <jomo> mean: xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-4.0-rc-1.zip ?  
13:44 <jomo> probably yes - it is for "Should be used by first-time users who do not need/want to use one of the installers above." - read for me ;)  
13:45 <vmassol> you can also use the jar installer if you prefer but this one is easy enough to use  
13:47 <jomo> the jar - as i understand - is graphical - i need install it headless (remote) freebsd (only ssh access).. afternoon will give a second try… thanx you a lot.  
13:47 <vmassol> yep so the zip is good  
13:48 <vmassol> actually the jar will work too AFAIR (since it detects headless and goes in console mode - but anyway try the zip  
13:48 <vmassol> (the zip is better supported)  
13:49 <jomo> downloading the zip - soon will my wife call me to eat - so, with full throat i will be in better mood.. ;) ;) :)  
13:49 <vmassol> hehe :)  
15:15 <jomo> yes - this is the right version for me… ;) anyway, when trying install extensions - sometimes at the first attempt i got error message like: "We couldn't find any extension with id 'jeromevelociter:column-macro' and version '1.0'.", but in second try, the extension is installed OK...  
15:16 <vmassol> strange  
15:17 <jomo> only FYI :)  
15:17 <vmassol> would be interesting to debug it and fix the problem is any  
15:18 <jomo> i got this into log: "Caused by: java.io.IOException: Invalid answer (500) fo the server when requesting  
15:18 <jomo>         at org.xwiki.extension.repository.xwiki.internal.XWikiExtensionRepository.getRESTResource(XWikiExtensionRepository.java:125) ~[xwiki-commons-extension-repository-xwiki-handler-4.0-rc-1.jar:na]  
15:18 <jomo> "  
15:18 <jomo> so, the extension repository returns "500"  
15:19 <vmassol> jomo: if you've got the time, it would be great to report it at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS  
15:20 <jomo> huh - going to try...  
15:32 <abusenius\_> has quit  
15:34 <abusenius\_> has joined #xwiki

17:50 <cjd> has joined #xwiki

18:02 <jomo> has joined #xwiki  
18:27 <jomo> how to sort attachment by name?  
18:27 <jomo> attachments  
18:52 <@sdumitriu> Where? In the attachments tab, or in a script inside a page?  
19:11 <jomo> in the attachments tab.  
19:14 <jomo> or, how to replace the default "attachments tab" with the Attachments Macro - http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Attachments+Macro  
19:15 <jomo> in the whole xwiki installation  
19:59 <jomo\_> has joined #xwiki  
20:00 <jomo> has quit  
20:00 <jomo\_> is now known as <jomo>  
21:36 <CIA-74> Vincent Massol master \* r20db1a8 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/commit/20db1a8579a995af30e867ecd9d8e7c0ec1a5689 / (6 files in 6 dirs): XCOMMONS-160: Upgrade to Hamcrest 1.2.1 and add matchers to JUnit tests - http://git.io/T\_e1uQ  
21:37 <CIA-74> Vincent Massol master \* r1c21640 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/1c216404d9a718d85eeb944d162dc126574a12aa / (2 files in 2 dirs): XCOMMONS-160: Upgrade to Hamcrest 1.2.1 and add matchers to JUnit tests - http://git.io/blUZJA  
21:42 <CIA-74> Vincent Massol cts \* r71b1e80 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/commit/71b1e80774074c9540cdd1c30f2652c34996208e / (31 files in 22 dirs): XRENDERING-187: Implement a Rendering Compatibility Test Suite ...  
21:42 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: I don't get it, why did you remove <scope>test</scope> from the main pom?  
21:43 <@sdumitriu> Do we often need it with the compile scope?  
21:43 <vmassol> because depmgmt should never use scope IMO  
21:43 <vmassol> and we don't use that anyway  
21:44 <vmassol> we don't use for junit dep nor for any other dep  
21:44 <vmassol> there's no reason to have it for hamcrest  
21:44 <@sdumitriu> We have it for servlet-api  
21:44 <@sdumitriu> So that in case someone forgets to add scope provided, we don't end up with it in the war  
21:45 <vmassol> yes it's ok for servlet-api  
21:46 <@sdumitriu> 3.5.1 Release in progress  
21:46 <vmassol> cool  
21:46 <@sdumitriu> I had a strange build failure the first time  
21:46 <@sdumitriu> Couldn't find some commons artifacts, although they were in the local repo  
21:47 <@sdumitriu> I didn't change anything and this time it seems to work  
21:47 <vmassol> spooky  
21:53 <jomo> has quit  
21:53 <jomo> has joined #xwiki  
21:53 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: 13 months after we moved to GitHub, how do you feel about it?  
21:53 <jomo> has quit  
21:53 <jomo> has joined #xwiki  
21:54 <vmassol> I still feel like a newbie with it :)  
21:54 <vmassol> it's ok  
21:54 <vmassol> but  
21:54 <vmassol> I actually use very little of it  
21:54 <vmassol> I mostly use it like I was using subversion so far  
21:54 <vmassol> it's good we have github  
21:54 <vmassol> I can feel its power though  
21:54 <vmassol> and it's cool for stats ;)  
21:55 <vmassol> that's about it!  
21:55 <vmassol> it works quite well for merges  
21:55 <vmassol> that's very cool too  
21:55 <vmassol> next step is probably to use more feature branches but that requires some special jenkins configuration  
21:56 <vmassol> there's a jenkins feature to automatically merge feature branch in master  
21:56 <vmassol> to verify integration  
21:56 <vmassol> since this is the main issue I can see with feature branches  
21:56 <vmassol> (the lack of integration)  
21:56 <vmassol> (ie pushing integration to late)
